page_title_en: Star Wars The Last Jedi Director Says Making The Movie Was High Point Of His Life
page_description_en: Rian Johnson is hopeful that his planned new trilogy eventually gets made.
page_text_html:
Rian Johnson directed one of the most divisive Star Wars films, The Last Jedi, and he says making the movie was a career highlight. The director also briefly touched on how he's hopeful to return to Star Wars one day, perhaps to develop the new Star Wars trilogy that he has discussed before.

Speaking to Variety, Johnson said it'll be some time before he potentially returns to Star Wars. The next film he plans to write is a third Knives Out film for Netflix. After that, Star Wars might come next.

"Making Star Wars was the high point of my life, and I pray to God I'll be back there someday," he said.

#GlassOnion director Rian Johnson says that "making 'Star Wars' was the high point of [his] life": "I pray to God I'll be back there someday." https://t.co/oQGYpLVBOC pic.twitter.com/w22ut9Nfus

— Variety (@Variety) November 15, 2022

Johnson's new Star Wars trilogy is reportedly on the backburner, but he's hopeful to make more Star Wars films one day. In September, Johnson said he remains close with Lucasfilm boss Kathleen Kennedy and that they "get together often and talk about it."

In related news, Johnson recently spoke about how he is "even more proud" of The Last Jedi, five years later.

The next Star Wars movie to come is the new film from Taika Waititi, followed by Wonder Woman director Patty Jenkins' new Rogue Squadron film. Waititi's new Star Wars movie will be released in late 2023.

Lucasfilm has put the Star Wars movie series on hiatus and is currently focusing more on Star Wars TV series. Andor is at the end of its first season, while The Mandalorian returns for its third season in 2023. Upcoming new Star Wars TV series include Ahsoka, Skeleton Crew, and The Acolyte, among others.

Johnson's Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery releases on November 23 in theaters before coming to Netflix on December 23.
